ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The group theory is a very interesting and useful class especially for students who study physics. I would strongly recommend it.
I would absolutely recommend it. The workload is very low, and the class is very helpful for courses like QFT.

I would say that it is a course that you can learn a lot from but you have to be willing to put in the work. You can probably do okay in the class without learning much but Professor Iachello will help you learn a lot if you are willing to put in the effort

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Group theory is useful in many physics fields. Although I'm not a theorist, learning group theory definitely helps me understand physics more deeply. It provides a "higher" angle of view to better understand many physical problems.
This course gave me the foundations for my future work in theoretical or experimental particle physics.
